ru.borisevich.emailgenerator.db.mysql

Class DBConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.borisevich.emailgenerator.db.mysql.DBConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class DBConnector
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    The DBConnector class is the element between classes that make requests and database. It stores all the necessary information to work with database, such as username, password, name of database, info about driver, pool etc. AutoCloseable is being implemented, so this class must be used in try-with-resource constructions, because connections must be returned to the pool after action is complete.

      • executeStatement

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeStatement(java.lang.String sqlCommand)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        A method to get information from database, which is being stored in ResultSet. To access members in ResultSet use next() method.
        Parameters:
        sqlCommand - A query to database which should be executed
        Returns:
        A ResultSet, containing results of SQL query.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Being thrown by either Connection, Statement or ResultSet if something goes wrong while accessing database.

      • executeUpdate

        public int executeUpdate(java.lang.String sqlCommand)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Same as executeStatement(), but for statements which modify the database (e.g. update, delete or add information).
        Parameters:
        sqlCommand - a ResultSet, containing results of SQL query.
        Returns:
        the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Being thrown by either Connection, Statement or ResultSet if something goes wrong while accessing database.
